metadata.dc:description: This is a review of publications comparing the results of medical and surgical treatment of morbid obesity. An overall conclusions is that the frequency of cardiovascular complications or cancer is higher among patients receiving medical treatment. Surgical treatment is associated with a better weight loss, reduction in complications and quality of life. Mortality risk decreases significantly after surgical treatment, when compared with patients receiving medical therapy Therefore, management of morbid obesity should be carried out by multidisciplinary teams with experience on gastrointestinal surgery. In this way the complications and mortality of bariatric surgery would be minimized.
metadata.dc:title: Comparación del tratamiento médico y quirúrgico en pacientes con obesidad grado III (obesidad mórbida).
[Review of the results of medical and surgical treatment of morbid obesity].
